Dr. Maria Carrillo  Vice President  Medical & Scientific Relations at the Alzheimer's Association  talks with CNN International about new research findings that show how scientists were able to stop brain cell death in mice.
Tune in to Katie Couric today for a special memory episode featuring Alzheimer’s Association Early-Stage Advisor  Sandy Oltz  and celebrity Champion Victor Garber!  #ENDALZ

We are partnering with Chicken Soup for the Soul to produce a book about life with Alzheimer's and dementia. Your words can inspire others and let them know that they are not alone. Submit your story by October 15.

My Dad's bout with Alzheimer's was short in comparison to many  but his decline has had a lasting effect. 25 years later  every time I forget a word  I fear I may have the same fate. -- A daughter shares the many reasons she Walks to End Alzheimer's
Pati Hoffman  who is living with early-stage Alzheimer's  throws out the 1st pitch at Wrigley Field. Thank you Cubs  for joining us in the fight to end Alzheimer's. #ENDALZ
Yesterday  the National Institutes of Health (NIH) awarded $45 Million in additional funds to innovative Alzheimer's research projects.  #ENDALZ

Yesterday  Senator Jerry Moran gave a floor speech advocating for more Alzheimer's research and that a sustained federal commitment to research for Alzheimer's will lower costs and improve health outcomes for people living with the disease today and in the future. Watch his speech below.
It's time we launched a serious war on Alzheimer's disease  writes USA TODAY Opinion columnist  Don Campbell. Join us in the fight to #ENDALZ!
The Dodgers helped raise Alzheimer's Awareness today—the 4th MLB team to do so this month! Thank you #Dogers for helping to  #ENDALZ
The New York Yankees join us in the fight to #ENDALZ! #ThankYouYankees
Grounds crew goes purple for Alzheimer's awareness at Great American Ball Park! Thank you Cincinnati Reds. #GoPurple #ENDALZ

No rivalry here! The New York Yankees team with five other Major League Baseball teams to help promote Alzheimer’s awareness. http://bit.ly/18vMEg3 Coach Pat Summitt and Alzheimer’s Association CEO Harry Johns take the field at Yankee Stadium for a pregame ceremony  #ThankYouYankees

Go Purple! Help raise awareness by changing your profile pic to  ENDALZ for World Alzheimer's Month. (Just copy  save and upload from our profile pic or get more detailed directions by clicking on the link below.)
Karen is a mother of two  who works full time. Her husband  Jim  is living with younger-onset Alzheimer’s. She shares her journey in hopes it inspires other to join the fight to #ENDALZ

I have made my Nana a promise: When she can no longer speak about the disease  I will speak for her. One teen talks about why he became an Alzheimer's advocate  and lets other kids dealing with Alzheimer's know they aren't alone.
We all have a reason to WALK. Sign up today http://bit.ly/16gNzoT & tell us who you WALK for.

More than 5 000 attendees gathered in Boston for the Alzheimer's Association International Conference this week sharing research updates in an effort to advance the discovery of scientific breakthroughs leading to methods of prevention  treatment  and ultimately  a cure for Alzheimer’s disease. www.alz.org/aaic

More than 4 800 attendees from 70 countries worldwide gather in Boston for the Alzheimer's Association International Conference 2013 to celebrate 25 years of scientific progress while accelerating and shaping the future of dementia science.
Happy 4th of July! Have a safe and happy holiday. Our 24/7 helpline is available if you need us. 800.272.3900
Too hard to get to a support group in person? Join our free  online caregiver community. http://bit.ly/1czonrM Having someone to share experiences with who truly understands can be a great support.
Walk to End Alzheimer's is happening now! Join or start a team  and tell us who you are walking for: http://bit.ly/1amEjRl

YOU are our hope for a world without Alzheimer's. Learn 5 easy things you can do to help right now: http://bit.ly/13aeS3X It can be as simple as sharing this post to raise awareness that more than 5 million Americans are living with this disease.  #ENDALZ
Caregiving is love! But no one can do it alone. We have free resources to help at www.alz.org/care  including tips  support groups & online tools.

As the sun sets on The Longest Day  we have hope for a world without Alzheimer's! Thousands of Alzheimer's champions worked to make a difference today. THANK YOU for your tireless efforts.  Your passion inspires us: http://bit.ly/l8wI2b
Little champions honoring the strength of those with Alzheimer's as part of The Longest Day. Join them: http://bit.ly/11rTrbm & share to raise awareness.

Tomorrow  thousands like Molly  will participate in a 16-hour event to honor those with Alzheimer's. "Like" to cheer on Molly and all our Alzheimer's champions on The Longest Day. http://usat.ly/11QD1G1

A daughter shares her journey as caregiver for her father. A must read for Father’s Day. “Like” to show your support for all the dads  grandfathers  brothers & friends living with or caring for someone with Alzheimer’s or dementia.

Without participation in clinical trials  finding a cure for Alzheimer's is impossible. Help move research forward. Find a clinical trial at www.alz.org/trialmatch.  People with dementia and healthy volunteers are needed.

Glen Campbell's daughter  Ashley  courageously testified at the Senate Aging Committee hearing today about her father's battle with Alzheimer's disease. The hearing evaluated the implementation the country’s first-ever National Plan to Address Alzheimer’s Disease.

Hundreds of dedicated Alzheimer's advocates went to Washington  D.C.  for the 25th annual Alzheimer's Association Advocacy Forum  where they learned  shared and directly appealed to their elected officials for meaningful action on Alzheimer's disease issues.

Tonight at the Alzheimer's Association National Dinner  Glen Campbell received the Sargent and Eunice Shriver Profiles in Dignity Award and celebrated his 77th birthday with his wife  daughter and more than 900 advocates. http://ht.ly/kiPXX
Our thoughts are with everyone at the Boston Marathon. Please stay safe.

Cheer on Joey McIntyre next week when he runs the Boston Marathon to raise funds & awareness for Alzheimer's. In his own words:"My mom has Alzheimer’s. And its not getting any better. And the only way to make it better for anyone is research. And research costs money. So for my mom and so so many families affected by this disease  I ask you to donate whatever you can to the Alzheimer's Association BECAUSE EVERY DOLLAR MATTERS!" http://www.crowdrise.com/joeymacsrun/fundraiser/joeymcintyre1
BREAKING NEWS: The Administration announced an additional $100 million within the President's FY 2014 budget toward the fight against Alzheimer's. Your advocacy efforts matter!
Our thoughts go out to the family of Margaret Thatcher and all those who are living with or who have lived with dementia.

Watch Marilu Henner present the Alzheimer's Association with a check for $50 000! Her win on "All-Star Celebrity Apprentice" got us this first donation and your "likes" helped us get more money to end Alzheimer's! Thank you!
$1 goes to the Alzheimer's Association for every "like" on Biosilk Facebook page. It's a super easy way to help us raise funds to end Alzheimer's. #ENDALZ

Fact: An estimated 450 000 people in the United States will die with Alzheimer’s in 2013. Want to help #ENDALZ? Check out our new event  The Longest Day  and "Like" if you are ready for a world without Alzheimer's.

Another new fact: In 2012  15.4 million family & friends provided 17.5 billion hours of unpaid care. Alzheimer’s takes a devastating toll not just on those with the disease–but also on their caregivers. Share the facts and help us change the future.

Since 2000  deaths from Alzheimer’s have risen 68 percent—while deaths from other major diseases have decreased. Help us end Alzheimer's. Learn the facts. Pass them on. "Like" if you are in it until Alzheimer's is finished.
New Alzheimer's Facts & Figures out today. 1 in 3 seniors dies with Alzheimer's or another dementia. Share the facts. Change the future.

Happy 100th birthday to Mr. Jerome Stone  who founded the Alzheimer's Association in honor of  his late  wife Evelyn in 1979. It is an honor to celebrate and thank you for your vision and years of dedication to the Alzheimer’s movement!

Marshalls stores nation-wide are getting customers involved in the fight to end Alzheimer’s! Shoppers who visit a Marshalls store today through March 16 can donate a dollar to the Alzheimer’s Association at check-out and help further our vision for a world without Alzheimer’s disease.

Marshalls stores nation-wide are getting customers involved in the fight to end Alzheimer’s! Shoppers who visit a Marshalls store March 3-16 can donate a dollar to the Alzheimer’s Association at check-out and help further our vision for a world without Alzheimer’s disease.

Join us on June 21  2013 for The Longest Day  as together we honor those living with Alzheimer’s disease and their caregivers. Organize a team for this sunrise-to-sunset event and raise funds and awareness for Alzheimer’s care  support and research.
A heart-felt thank you  this Valentine's Day  to all of our volunteers  donors and advocates. Your passion and dedication continue to move us closer to a world without Alzheimer's.

Did you hear Alzheimer's mentioned in tonight's State of the Union? "Scientists are mapping the human brain to unlock the answers to Alzheimer's... Now is the time to reach a level of research and development not seen since the Space Race." We have momentum in the fight against Alzheimer's. Join the movement to #ENDALZ.

Tune into Speed Channel at 3:30 p.m. ET to watch AC/DC front man Brian Johnson & the Fifty Plus Racing team cross the finish line for ‘Highway to Help’ benefiting the Alzheimer’s Association at the Rolex 24 at Daytona. Check out fiftyplusracing.com.
Dear Abby brought international awareness to Alzheimer's disease long before her own diagnosis. Read the inspiring story at alz.org.blog
Our hearts go out to the family of Pauline Phillips  known to many as "Dear Abby " and all those who have lived with or are living with Alzheimer's disease.
Congratulations to Alzheimer's Association Champion  Bradley Cooper  on his Golden Globes and Academy Awards nominations for Best Actor in "Silver Linings Playbook!"

Start your engines! AC/DC front man Brian Johnson and the Fifty Plus Racing team kicked off “Highway to Help” benefiting the Alzheimer’s Association this weekend at the Roar Before the Rolex 24 at the Daytona International Speedway. To donate and learn more  visit www.fiftyplusracing.com

The holidays are a time when family and friends often come together. But for families living with Alzheimer's and other dementias  the holidays can be challenging. Take a deep breath. With some planning and adjusted expectations  your celebrations can still be happy  memorable occasions.

Three of our First Ladies have led the crusade for caregivers: Hillary Clinton  Nancy Reagan and Rosalynn Carter.  All three are passionate advocates for our nation’s 65 million caregivers because they have taken the caregiving journey themselves. Read our blog for more about our First Lady Caregivers.
Check out the amazing Hilarity for Charity team at the Walk to End Alzheimer's in LA this morning!

November is National Alzheimer's Disease Awareness Month and National Family Caregivers Month. In the United States alone  there are nearly 15 million Alzheimer's and dementia caregivers. Join us in honoring them by sharing a personal tribute message.

GRAMMY-winning singer  Amy Grant  shares her personal experience caring for her aging parents  both who were diagnosed with dementia. She shares her story and how she still focuses her energy on her dad who is still living with the disease.

James Keach  award winning director & producer  and recipient of the Champion Award at the 2012 Alzheimer's Association Rita Hayworth New York Gala - with his wife  Jane Seymour and producing partner Trevor Albert  joins in the fight to end Alzheimer's and shares why now is the time to find a cure!

Throughout the 2011 and 2012 Major League Baseball seasons  FOX Sports broadcaster  Ken Rosenthal  has rocked several BowTies raising awareness for various charities. The Alzheimer's Association BowTie is in the running for Ken to wear during this year's MLB World Series. Just click "Like" to vote for your favorite! Voting ends Oct. 22.
There is a growing movement to increase animal/patient interactions for health and wellness benefits. Read about how caregivers can use pet therapy to care for their loved one.
Like Representative Paul Ryan  one in three voters has a loved one with Alzheimer's disease. It's a devastating disease on families & a threat to our healthcare system.

One of the best football games this season is being played by women across the country – and they are playing to win the battle against Alzheimer’s disease. Read more about two sisters  Sara Allen Abbott and Kate Allen Stukenberg  who were inspired by their dad's diagnosis  to fight Alzheimer's disease and create Blondes v. Brunettes.

What if you were made to feel different because of a disease you couldn’t control? The stigma associated with Alzheimer’s is real and something people with this disease and their families face every day. It’s World Alzheimer’s Month. Speak up and fight stigma with these tips.

A HUGE thank you to all who supported Alzheimer's Action Day today! We saw TV anchors around the country Go Purple and tell viewers about the importance of Alzheimer's awareness  buildings were lit up with purple lights  tens of thousands of you changed your profile picture on Facebook and Twitter to #ENDALZ and shared messages to help break the barriers of the stigma that surround Alzheimer's!
The White House is recognizing those affected with Alzheimer's disease on Alzheimer's Action Day! Read more about what the Administration is doing in the fight to end Alzheimer's.

It's Alzheimer's Action Day! YOU have made this day possible. Tell us how you are Going Purple  and if you haven’t already changed your profile pic to the END ALZ graphic  join us now. Together  we can make a difference.

Thursday   Cheech Marin won big for the Alzheimer's Association during Celebrity Week on “Who Wants to be a Millionaire.” Keep watching all week to see celebrities play an exciting game for the cause!  And click here for local time and channel to watch Celebrity Week:http://bit.ly/zWiPv4!
Tomorrow is Alzheimer’s Action Day! Don’t forget to wear purple and help us raise awareness by changing your profile pic to our END ALZ icon. Ask your friends to do the same.

Dave Stephens is walking more than 200 miles to honor his dad during World Alzheimer’s Month! Read his story and get involved. This Friday is Alzheimer’s Action Day and your chance to help raise awareness.

Help us turn Facebook purple on September 21  Alzheimer's Action Day. Change your profile pic to our END ALZ graphic and ask your friends to do the same. Together  we can raise awareness and help end Alzheimer's. Learn more at: www.alz.org/wam

Jewelry designer Holly Freeman started a line of limited edition pieces with friend and actress Jamie-Lynn Sigler.  In honor of World Alzheimer’s Month  the two philanthropists designed a purple bracelet. Learn more about Holly's inspiration to Go Purple and fight to End Alzheimer's.

So many ways to Go Purple and show your support during World Alzheimer’s Month! Change your profile pic to END ALZ. Wear purple this Friday. Help overcome stigma by raising awareness. Then  ask your friends to do the same.

Tune in this week for Celebrity Week on “Who Wants to Be a Millionaire” with all proceeds going to the Alzheimer’s Association!  Mo’Nique  Cheech Marin  Paula Deen  Jackée and “Dancing with the Stars” professional Tony Dovolani each play an exciting game for the cause.
Less than one week until Alzheimer’s Action Day. How will you Go Purple on September 21? Need ideas? Check out our Pinterest Board. http://bit.ly/pin4alz

Kathy Murray  who was diagnosed at 56 with younger-onset Alzheimer's  is speaking up during World Alzheimer's Month.  "Keep talking openly about Alzheimer’s  and little by little  it will get easier." Read her story and learn how you can get involved at www.alz.org/wam

Often because of misinformation—and even fear—people with Alzheimer’s disease and their families are held at arm’s length. Together  we can change that. Take action for World Alzheimer’s Month!  Speak up and educate others about the realities of Alzheimer’s.  > http://bit.ly/alzstig

What do New Kids on the Block singer Joey McIntyre  football star Terrell Owens and actor Seth Rogen have in common? They are all wearing purple to support the Alzheimer’s Association and our mission for a world without Alzheimer’s! You can “Go Purple” too – check out our new items on Shop! www.alz.org/shop

World Alzheimer’s Month is your chance to join in the global fight against Alzheimer’s! All month long  you can raise awareness about Alzheimer’s and help reduce the stigma surrounding the disease that people with the disease & their caretakers encounter. Take a stand and “Go Purple” to end Alzheimer’s!
It's World Alzheimer's Month! Read one caregiver’s story of breaking past the stigma of Alzheimer’s and finding hope. Then help raise awareness by passing it along. Together we can end Alzheimer's!
Today kicks-off World Alzheimer’s Month. Join us in the global fight against Alzheimer’s disease by going purple! Watch the video and pass it on.

Help us raise awareness on Alzheimer's Action Day  Sept. 21  by changing your profile picture to our END ALZ graphic. Together  we can help end Alzheimer's! More ideas on how to go purple at www.alz.org/wam

Tomorrow starts World Alzheimer’s Month! Take a sneak peak to see how you can Go Purple  Get Inspired and Share Your Story. All September long we’ll share ways you can help spread awareness about Alzheimer’s and get involved with the cause!

Thank you to everyone who voted! We've been chosen as one of the five charities in this year's "Share the Love" event! Subaru will donate $250 to the owners' choice of these five charities for every new Subaru vehicle sold or leased from
Read Mary Grace Peak's post about remembering what makes her mother - now living with Alzheimer's - so special and how she sees her spirit every day in her own daughter.
What's the one thing you never want to forget? Tell us your "one thing" & share this video to raise Alzheimer's awareness. More awareness means more funding and more support for those affected.

Dr. Bill Thies of the Alzheimer's Association discusses new research presented at the Alzheimer's Association International Conference about an experimental drug trial which has shown results to slow progression of Alzheimer's disease on CBS This Morning.

Breaking news! First study to report long-term stabilization of Alzheimer's symptoms through IVIG treatment released today at the Alzheimer’s Association International Conference. A phase III trial is now in progress. More definitive data will be available in the upcoming year.

A son who lost his mother to Alzheimer's 5 years ago writes to Abby about his lasting feelings of guilt over a decision to place his mother in assisted living. Such feelings are common. If you are a caregiver  know that you aren't alone.  Support is available at: www.alz.org/care

We still see glimpses of mom — her smile  her warmth and a little of her sense of humor — that is what makes it worthwhile to do what it takes to care for her every day and night. A quote from a true hero -- Wade  an Alzheimer's caregiver & participant in The Longest Day.

The sun is rising on the longest day – and people across the globe are participating in a sunrise-to-sunset relay to honor those with Alzheimer’s and their caregivers. Follow their progress and cheer them on!
Yesterday  former Tennessee Lady Vol's coach Pat Summitt received the nation's highest civilian honor from President Obama as one of 13 Medal of Freedom recipients. Congrats to Coach Summitt!
A good read: Four working women share how they are balancing motherhood with the intense demands of caring for someone with Alzheimer's in this special report.

Last night was a special evening at the Library of Congress! Members of Congress were invited to the "Alzheimer's Association Evening with Glen Campbell" to learn about Alzheimer's disease and hear a special performance by country music legend  Glen Campbell who is living with the disease.

Get a personal perspective on what the National Alzheimer's Plan means from Dr. Stephen Hume  Alzheimer's Association national board member and person living with the disease. " … if we are all successful together  millions of American wives  husbands  sisters and brothers will be freed from the personal and financial devastation of this terrible disease."

It's an historic day! The first ever National Alzheimer's Plan has been released by the Administration with the important goal of preventing & effectively treating Alzheimer's by 2025. Your efforts got us here. You signed the petition  advocated on Capitol Hill & told elected officials that Alzheimer's couldn't wait. Your voices were heard. Thank you!

With your support  we collected close to 240 000 signatures on our petition asking the President for a strong National Alzheimer's Plan. Thank you! Together  we sent a message that Alzheimer's can't wait.
Do you have questions about whether coconut oil can treat Alzheimer's? Read our expert blog post and get answers.
Recent honorees at the National Alzheimer's Dinner in Washington  DC  Coach Pat Summitt and her son Tyler share their story about fighting Alzheimer's together.

Thank you to all our amazing advocates who descended upon Washington this week to learn about & share important messages to increase Alzheimer's awareness on Capitol Hill! Thank you to all who signed our petition & let your voice be heard - you were all here in spirit! Below  Alzheimer's Assoc. President & CEO  Harry Johns welcomes all to the National Alzheimer's Dinner - more photos to come!

Tonight  we honor Coach Pat Summitt and son  Tyler  with the Sargent & Eunice Shriver Profiles in Dignity Award. Alzheimer's champion Maria Shriver will present the award at the Alzheimer's Association National Dinner. Check back for photos.
Hundreds of advocates are arriving in D.C. today for the Alzheimer's Association Advocacy Forum. Help them deliver the message that Alzheimer's can't wait by signing & sharing our petition.

Sign our petition for a strong National Alzheimer's Plan! We are less than 50 000 signatures away from our goal & need your help to reach it by next week when a record number of advocates will go to D.C. to deliver the message that Alzheimer's can't wait!

Eight months after announcing her Alzheimer’s diagnosis  Pat Summitt  legendary basketball coach of the Tennessee Lady Vols  stepped down today from her position as head coach. In her courageous and strong spirit she will continue with the team as “head coach emeritus ” collaborating on game plans and continuing as a motivator  disciplinarian and mentor. Today we are all Lady Volunteers.
Celebrity Alzheimer's champions share how the disease has affected them in our latest blog post. Read it now.

Filmmaker Scott Kirschenbaum shares his experience making a documentary in an Alzheimer's unit on our blog. His film  "You're Looking at Me Like I Live Here but I Don't " airs on PBS tonight at 10 p.m.
Singer Joey McIntyre shares how Alzheimer’s has affected his life on our blog . Read his story and cheer him on as he runs the Hollywood Half Marathon to honor his mother and help fight Alzheimer’s.

We just awarded our largest-ever research grant! Nearly $4.2 million to the Dominantly Inherited Alzheimer's Network–Therapeutic Trials Unit (DIAN-TTU). The Association believes this project has the potential to dramatically accelerate the pace of discovery of treatment & prevention strategies for Alzheimer's. Need information about ongoing Alzheimer's trials? Visit alz.org/trialmatch

Join us for a free Webinar on the common challenges facing caregivers of loved ones with Alzheimer’s disease. We've got tips on how to help.  It's completely free and starts at 2:00 p.m. ET this Thursday. March 22.  Register now!

Did you know one in eight older Americans has Alzheimer’s disease? And an estimated one out of seven individuals with the disease live alone. If you or someone you know lives alone and needs help  please contact our 24/7 helpline at 800-272-3900. Learn the facts and find out more in the 2012 Alzheimer’s Disease Facts and Figures.

A good read! Care expert Carrie Steckl—who lost her grandmother to Alzheimer's—shares her reaction to the new Alzheimer's Disease Facts and Figures Report and talks about the reality of how many caregivers are among us.

Costs of caring for people with Alzheimer’s and other dementias will soar from the estimated $200 billion this year to a projected $1.1 trillion per year by 2050. Sign the petition and tell the Nation's leaders we need a National Plan to find a cure or slow the progression of Alzheimer’s disease.

Did you know an estimated 5.4 million Americans live with Alzheimer’s disease and that it is the only 1 in the top 10 leading causes of death without a way to prevent  cure or even slow its progression? Learn the facts and find out more in the 2012 Alzheimer’s Disease Facts and Figures Report.

On June 20  2012  the longest day of the year  teams across the northern hemisphere will participate in a sunrise-to-sunset endurance activity to honor the passion  dedication and strength displayed by people with Alzheimer's and their caregivers  and to raise funds for Alzheimer's care  support and research. Join them for The Longest Day!
Caregivers take note! Read our new blog post by expert Sherri Snelling about the power of music for people with Alzheimer's and dementia.

The first draft of the National Alzheimer's Plan has been released and addresses developing new treatments  much needed support for families and enhancing care quality. It's another positive step! As the draft plan is revised  we urge the Administration to specify the level of investment that will be needed to meet the goal to prevent and effectively treat Alzheimer's by 2025. Add your voice by signing our petition.
Great Valentine's Day read for caregivers!
Did you see Glen Campbell's moving performance last night?

US government commits an immediate $50 million for Alzheimer's research and a total of $130 million to research  caregiver support and education over the next two years. It's a great first step. Sign our petition so the government understands the need for more in the future to END ALZ. http://bit.ly/petitionfb

News on the horizon. Tomorrow morning  HHS is hosting “We Can’t Wait: Obama Administration Announcement on Alzheimer’s Disease.” But your support is still needed! Help us reach our new goal of 250 000 signatures by signing our petition. Pass it on to friends and family urging them to support our call for a strong National Alzheimer’s Plan.

Read our new blog post. It's one woman's story about love  football and what it takes to be a caregiver for a spouse with dementia. Sylvia Mackey shares her memories about taking care of husband and legendary football player John Mackey for the first time.
Send a message to Washington that we need a strong National Alzheimer's Plan! Sign the petition and help us meet this week’s goal of 75 000 signatures! We're almost there.

Tell President Obama Alzheimer's can't wait!  We’re all counting on him to fulfill the potential of the National Alzheimer's Project Act. Sign the petition and pass it on. The more voices the stronger our message!

Let President Obama know that it's time to fulfill the promise of the National Alzheimer's Project Act. Millions of families are counting on him to ask for support of the National Alzheimer's plan when he releases his upcoming Budget Request to Congress. With your help  our message will be heard that Alzheimer's can't wait. Sign the petition!
Remembering the legendary Etta James and all those who have lived or are living with dementia.

Are you an Alzheimer’s Champion? Join Bradley Cooper  Leslie Mann  Anthony Anderson and others who are taking action in the fight against Alzheimer’s and declare yourself a Champion! http://www.actionalz.org/

The call for an effective and aggressive National Alzheimer’s Plan continues with the Associated Press exclaiming “US wants effective treatment for Alzheimer’s by 2025.” Tell us what you think about the framework for the National Alzheimer’s Plan at napa.alz.org.

Read the USAToday story: “US launches national war on Alzheimer’s.” Learn about one couple’s experience with Alzheimer’s and the need for an aggressive National Alzheimer’s Plan to prevent and treat Alzheimer's. Then  share your thoughts about the recently released framework for the National Plan at napa.alz.org
Every 69 seconds someone in the U.S. develops Alzheimer's. Learn the facts and figures  and pass them on.  Awareness will help us END ALZ.

Tune in to CBS for the first-ever Celebrity Week on The Price is Right! Check your local listings to watch tomorrow’s show featuring musician Chris Daughtry as he plays to raise money for the Alzheimer’s Association!

We are pleased that Congress and President Obama have responded to our call on behalf of constituents to support federal programs critical to the Alzheimer’s community! The Fiscal Year 2012 Omnibus Appropriations bill  which passed last week and was signed by President Obama today  funds several Alzheimer’s initiative including dollars for innovative Alzheimer’s research and successful public private partnerships with the government to provide care and support to families.

We have info to help you  and those you love  recognize the most common warning signs of Alzheimer’s. The No. 1 sign in our top 10: memory problems that disrupt daily life. Learn the other nine & get information about typical age-related changes compared to Alzheimer's.
Get a researcher's perspective on the biggest challenge to finding effective treatments for Alzheimer's & find out how you can help at alz.org/trialmatch

In LA on January 13? Hang out with Seth Rogen and help fight Alzheimer’s at the first annual Hilarity for Charity event. Laugh and do good. Spread the word by "liking" it on FB: facebook.com/hilarity4charity

Congratulations to Coach Pat Summitt for being honored as Sports Illustrated Sportswoman of the Year! Even after receiving a diagnosis of younger-onset Alzheimer's she continues to make strides both on and off the court. For more information on younger-onset Alzheimer's visit: www.alz.org/alzheimers_disease_early_onset.asp

Patti Davis shares her personal story about father  President Ronald Reagan  being diagnosed with Alzheimer's disease and how it affected herself  her family and the country. Read Patti's full article  Ronald Reagan: My Disappearing Dad  featured in More magazine in the link below.
We are thankful – today and every day – for the millions of Alzheimer’s caregivers. We are grateful for their extraordinary dedication and the countless hours of care they provide.

326 140 participants; 39 060 teams; $44 500 000 raised (and counting) = 1 amazing year for Walk to End Alzheimer's! Thank you to our walkers  donors and volunteers for your dedication to a world without Alzheimer’s.

Congrats to Alzheimer’s Association Celebrity Champion Bradley Cooper for being named People magazine’s 2011 “Sexiest Man Alive!” Watch how he helped make our inaugural World Alzheimer’s Month a success.
Good read about early diagnosis & reminder that Alzheimer's clinical trials are out there. Find one at www.alz.org/trialmatch
Did you see the wonderful tribute to Glen Campbell at the CMA Awards last night?
November is National Alzheimer's Disease Awareness Month & National Family Caregivers Month. Share a personal tribute to a caregiver on our special Web page.
With your help  we passed our goal of 38 000 teams for the Walk to End Alzheimer's! Thank you for helping us move closer to a world without this disease.
Are you carving pumpkins? Download our free Alzheimer's Association stencils and have fun while supporting the cause.

NRDC Trustee Robert Redford asked us to share this message with you regarding today’s rejection of the #KeystoneXL pipeline:   "Today marks a huge turning point in our fight to leave a better future for our children and generations to come. People all over the country banded together to demand a stop to this short-sighted  destructive fossil fuel project. Thank you  to the President and all those who rallied against the pipeline." — Robert Redford

The State Department has decided that a Keystone XL Pipeline would not serve the national interest of the United States. I agree with that decision. — President Obama   We agree! Thank you  Barack Obama for stopping this disastrous tar sands pipeline!

BREAKING: President Obama just rejected the Keystone XL pipeline!  Here's a statement from NRDC president Rhea Suh: "This represents a courageous leap forward in the climate fight. Rejecting the Keystone XL tar sands pipeline is right for our nation  for our children and for our planet. It would have locked in  for a generation or more  massive development of among the dirtiest fuels on the planet – posing a serious threat to our air  land water  and climate. The proposal  pushed largely by the fossil fuel industry  was a recipe for disaster. In no way was the pipeline in America’s national interest. Dangerous climate change is the central environmental challenge of our time  and it’s time for everyone to step up now and meet that challenge."

Yesterday  NRDC and the U.S. Navy finally reached a federal court agreement—in the whales’ favor.   The U.S. Navy agreed to give marine mammals off California and Hawaii a break from deafening noise.

Victory! We sued the U.S. Navy and whales won!   After decades of advocacy and action  a campaign to protect marine mammals from harmful underwater sonar finally pays off — in an appropriately big way. Read about this hugely important news: http://on.nrdc.org/1UQkASt

BREAKING: The U.S. Navy has agreed to limit underwater assaults on whales and dolphins! Dangerous explosives and sonar training in Southern California and Hawaii would have killed hundreds of animals and harmed thousands more. NRDC and other groups took the Navy to court to stop this unnecessary harm. Thanks to this ruling  we can now protect our Navy fleet and safeguard our whales.
Great news! Appeals court overturns EPA's approval of insecticide known to be highly toxic to bees.

BREAKING: President Obama just announced new rules limiting U.S. ivory sales!  If finalized  these new regulations would place a near-total ban on domestic ivory sales  imports  and exports of African elephant ivory.  More than 100 000 elephants were killed by poachers between 2010 and 2012  leading some scientists to predict that African forest elephants could be extinct within the decade. The United States is a significant market for ivory.  Following is a statement by NRDC President Rhea Suh: “The truth of the matter is that the United States plays a very real role in the slaughter of African elephants. Our trade and import of ivory is part of the demand that is driving the near-extermination of this species.  That’s why our country needs to do everything in its power to protect these endangered and iconic animals. “Restricting sales and helping to reduce demand is a critical part of the solution. Though we still have plenty of work to do to protect elephants for good  these new regulations take us one step closer.” #ivory #elephants #conservation

BREAKING: The U.S. District Court  District of Hawaii  just ruled that the U.S. Navy's war games violate laws protecting whales and dolphins! This is a huge win for defenseless marine mammals  which are going deaf and hungry due to ocean noise and may die at the hands of our Navy.   The court ruled that the Navy’s training and testing activities off the coast of Southern California and Hawaii illegally harm more than 60 whale  dolphin  seal  and sea lion populations. And deems that nearly 9.6 million underwater assaults on whales and dolphins were improperly assessed as “negligible.” More to come in the morning  but we wanted to share the news and say THANK YOU to all of our members for helping support NRDC’s ability to fight these battles in the courts!

BREAKING NEWS: The Supreme Court just refused to delay clean air rules that will prevent up to 11 000 premature deaths and more than 100 000 asthma and heart attacks each year. The Mercury and Air Toxics Standards (MATS) protect against mercury and other dangerous toxics -- protections which are especially valuable to children and pregnant women -- at coal and oil-fired power plants.  Hundreds of thousands of Sierra Club supporters and members sent in comments to the EPA demanding a strong MATS rule! We did it together!

When Emma Gatewood read a National Geographic article that said no woman had ever completed the 2050-mile Appalachian Trail she told her daughter "'If those men can do it  I can do it." At 67 years old  she did  making history in the process. She completed the trek alone without a tent  sleeping bag  or compass and returned again two years later  becoming the first person of any gender to walk the entire trail twice: http://www.mentalfloss.com/article/70374/first-woman-hike-appalachian-trail-was-67-years-old

It's been a wild week! Yesterday was the anniversary of the Wilderness Act and today is National Wildlife Day.

51 years ago today  President Lyndon Johnson signed the Wilderness Act into law  forever protecting America's wild places. From Alaska all the way to the Florida Keys  over 750 stunning parts of our country  totaling over 110 million acres  have been permanently protected by this Act.  Today and every day  we celebrate the Wilderness Act as it ensures that everyone can continue to explore and enjoy our wild lands.  (Top left moving clockwise: Photos are of the wilderness areas of Denali in Alaska  Maroon Bells in Colorado  Isle Royale in Michigan  and Theodore Roosevelt in North Dakota).

When someone says 'Once in a Blue Moon ' you know what they mean: Rare  seldom  even absurd. This year it means 'the end of July.' For the second time this month  the Moon is about to become full. There was one full Moon on July 2nd  and now a second is coming on July 31st.  According to modern folklore  whenever there are two full Moons in a calendar month  the second one is 'blue.' The Vortex wind generator represents a fairly radical break with conventional wind turbine design  in that it has no spinning blades (or any moving parts to wear out at all)  and looks like nothing more than a giant straw that oscillates in the wind. It works not by spinning in the wind  but by taking advantage of a phenomenon called vorticity  or the Kármán vortex street  which is a 'repeating pattern of swirling vortices.'  Read more --> j.mp/1GfNVLQ  What do you think of this idea?

Women and girls in Sacala Las Lomas  Guatemala spend as much as five hours per day fetching water. On 23 February 1905  Paul Harris and three friends gathered for what would become known as the first Rotary club meeting. Harris’s desire for camaraderie among business associates grew into an international network of 1.2 million volunteers who work to improve health  alleviate poverty  and promote peace. Learn more about the founders of Rotary: http://ow.ly/JhnSC

Today  February 23  marks the 110th anniversary of Rotary. Over our 110 years  Rotary members have created access to education  empowered communities  pushed polio to the brink of eradication and improved lives around the world. Help us celebrate our birthday by sharing your favorite Rotary memories on social media. Read more: http://ow.ly/Jhsfv

Rotary International President Gary C.K. Huang invites you to join him at the 2015 #Rotary Convention in São Paulo  Brazil  from 6 to 9 June. Join us on social media with #RotaryUNDay on 1 November for #RotaryDay at the United Nations as we celebrate working together with the UN and other organizations to increase our humanitarian reach.  #Rotary holds the highest consultative status offered to a nongovernmental organization by the UN’s Economic and Social Council  which oversees many specialized UN agencies.

28 October celebrates the 100th anniversary of the birthday of Dr. Jonas Salk  who helped develop a #polio vaccine. As we continue the effort to end polio  we honor his contributions.  Read more about Dr. Salk in The Independent at http://ow.ly/Duhq6.

Raise awareness on #WorldPolioDay  24 October  that we will keep our promise to the world’s children to end polio. Find out more in our live event: www.endpolio.org.  More than 2.5 billion children have been immunized against polio. We’re not stopping until the job is done and polio is in the history books as the second human disease to be eradicated.
We want to keep our promise to the world's children and end polio. Learn more at www.endpolio.org.

Where are we in the fight to end polio? What have we accomplished? Can we make history together? Find out on #WorldPolioDay  24 October  during our Livestream event.   Get involved at www.endpolio.org/worldpolioday.

Why host a #Rotary Youth Exchange student? Victoria Alvarez  an exchange student from Argentina  explains how her time in the United States helped her grow more as a person than during any previous year of her life. Her advice to anyone considering an exchange? You will never regret it.   Read more in her post for #RotaryVoices.

Stand up for education and be #StrongerThan fear on #MalalaDay  14 July.  Malala Yousafzai was shot by the Taliban for advocating for girls’ education and is the daughter of a #Rotary member.   Show that you’re #StrongerThan fear  hatred  violence  and poverty by sharing this message on social media.

The 2015 #Rotary Convention (#ricon15) in São Paulo  Brazil  will be Saturday  6 June  to Tuesday  9 June. This means the convention starts and ends one day earlier than previously scheduled.  The dates were changed because the original opening day (Sunday  7 June) coincided with one of the city's most popular parades and significant traffic congestion.  Help spread the word by updating your websites  newsletters  and calendars with the new dates. Check www.riconvention.org regularly for dates  deadlines  and registration and housing details.  Check on other convention date changes at http://ow.ly/z0WeF.
Welcome to all the new Rotary officers as they start their new Rotary year on 1 July!

1 July is the start of the #Rotary year when about 34 000 club presidents take office. They can help start projects  work on membership  and much more. What do you think is the most important job of a club president?  Visit some of the tools we offer for clubs and districts at https://www.rotary.org/myrotary/en/manage/club-district-administration

To help attract members and lower dues  one #Rotary club replaced meals at their meetings with appetizers and a cash bar.  What are some of your favorite ideas for getting people interested in your club?

Thank you to Rotary member Sir Emeka Offor of Nigeria who  at the Rotary convention (#ricon14) on 3 June  gave another US$1 million to #Rotary to help end #polio.   Nigeria is one of three polio-endemic countries in the world. The other two are Afghanistan and Pakistan.  Learn how you can join the effort to end polio at www.endpolio.org.

Speaking on 1 June at our convention (#ricon14) kick off  Australian Prime Minister Tony Abbott announced his government's commitment of AU$100 million for #polio eradication and provide routine immunizations.  Learn more about Rotary's fight to end polio at www.endpolio.org.

#Rotary members smashed two world records on 30 May in their pursuit to raise funds and awareness about polio eradication. On the iconic Sydney Harbour Bridge  340 people waived 278 flags.   Because BridgeClimb Sydney donated 50 percent of all the ticket sales  that raised about AUD $110 000  with the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation contribution  for #polio eradication. This can immunize about 240 000 children against polio  which is a disease without a cure.  Follow the Rotary convention and preconvention events with #ricon14.
At www.riconvention.org  learn about what makes Rotary conventions inspiring. Follow the 2014 convention  1-4 June in Sydney  with #ricon14.

During World War II  Rotary member Sir Nicholas Winton helped save 669 children from the Nazis. On Sunday  27 April  7 p.m. Eastern time  his story will be on 60 Minutes.   You also can sign the petition to honor him with the Nobel Peace Prize at http://ow.ly/wbbcG. Sir Nicholas will be 105 on 19 May.

Our founder  Paul Harris (who was three in this photo)  was born 19 April 1868 in Racine  Wisconsin  USA. We honor the legacy he achieved.   Thank you to the #Rotary members and friends who continue his work and share his dream.   Strengthen Rotary by inviting people to your club or giving to The Rotary Foundation at www.rotary.org/give.

Celebrate World Health Day  7 April. It marks the anniversary of the founding of the World Health Organization (WHO) in 1948. Happy anniversary  WHO!   Thank you for your leadership on global health and being one of our #polio eradication partners – along with UNICEF  CDC  and the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation.  Around the world #Rotary members and friends take part in humanitarian projects in the areas of maternal and child health  polio eradication  and disease prevention and treatment.   Learn more at www.rotary.org.

Congratulations to the 1.8 billion people in 11 countries in the World Health Organization (WHO)'s South-East Asia region who are now officially polio-free!  It's been three years since the last case of #polio in that region  which includes India. This wouldn't have been possible without your support and the relentless work of millions of healthcare workers. Thank you.

The #Rotary Foundation will celebrate 100 years in 2016-17. To commemorate this occasion  we commissioned Rotary member and author David Forward to write the definitive history of our Foundation. Every great book deserves an equally great name  so we're asking your help to choose one.  From now through 15 June  you can vote for one of four selected titles or submit your own. Learn more at http://ow.ly/uVf14.

Water projects in Ghana are being carried out as part of the #Rotary International/USAID H2O Collaboration. The effort is providing more than 100 villages with clean water through installation of boreholes with hand pumps  along with sanitation facilities and hygiene training.  Raise awareness and make a difference on World Water Day (#WorldWaterDay)  22 March  by visiting www.rotary.org/give.

Every 20 seconds  a child dies as a result of poor sanitation. World Water Day (#WorldWaterDay)  22 March  is commemorated worldwide to help raise awareness.  #Water and sanitation is one of #Rotary’s areas of focus. Share this graphic on social media  and if you will be in Sydney on 30 May  attend the World Water Summit. Register and learn more at www.wasrag.org.

Show us your #rotaryhero on Instagram to win airline tickets to do good in the world. Take a picture of #Rotary in action  upload it to Instagram using #rotaryhero (include a caption and your photo credit) between now and 21 April  and the photo with the most votes wins United Charity Miles to anywhere in the world to be used toward a Rotary program or project.   See the official rules at www.rotary.org/document/107491

Congratulations Rotary Club of Tampa  in Florida  USA. It will be celebrating 100 years  -- and getting younger! The club has evolved and benefited from becoming more diverse  says club president Wayne Critcher.  Let us know if your club will be celebrating 100 years in 2014.

To the women who have given so much to #Rotary and to the men who supported their achievements  we thank you!  It's International Women’s Day (#IWD2014)! Share the message that equality for women means progress for all.

Congratulations to former Rotary Youth Exchange participant – and Academy-Award winner – Matthew McConaughey for his role in Dallas Buyers Club. #oscars  We're proud of our family of #Rotary!  Read more at http://ow.ly/ubq9O

Although our 109th anniversary was 23 February  the celebration continues!  About 50 clubs raised more than $66 000 in 15 countries for polio eradication with the Rotary: World's Greatest Meal to Help End Polio fundraiser. People can still sign up for this global fundraiser  which is run by #Rotary members.  The Rotary Global Swimarathon is another global polio eradication fundraiser held for Rotary's anniversary.   See more photos of #Rotary members celebrating our 109th at http://blog.rotary.org/2014/02/26/anniversary_gallery/. Tell us about your anniversary celebrations that raised funds for a good cause.

Rotary began in 23 February 1905 with four people who wanted to connect to others for business and as well as fun and civic service.  "The thought persisted that I was experiencing only what had happened to hundreds  perhaps thousands  of others " said Rotary founder Paul Harris.  Thank you to our #Rotary members and friends who are united for the common good. With you  we can accomplish even more.   Find out how you can help at www.rotary.org/give.

Rotary began in 23 February 1905 with a vision. Today we're working together worldwide both digitally and in-person to solve some of our world's most challenging problems  including eradicating #polio.  "Whatever #Rotary may mean to us  to the world it will be known by the results it achieves " Rotary founder Paul Harris.  Share what you've achieved through Rotary  or learn more about us at www.rotary.org.
Celebrate Valentine Day by giving to others at www.rotary.org/give.
Enter The Rotarian Magazine photo contest before it closes 28 February! Win a camera and see your photo in the June issue.  Learn more at http://bit.ly/JVCQHd

We'll post a few of our favorite videos on Facebook.  Read more at www.facebook.com/rotary/app_352070991586481

Malala spoke out about educating girls  and she was shot. Malala is one of us.

India celebrated three years of being #polio free by lighting up local landmarks!  Media around the world also noted this milestone  including Newsweek  TIME  The Wall Street Journal  BBC News  India Ink Blog (The New York Times)  The Canadian Press  The Guardian  and Agence France-Presse (AFP).  Get links to these articles and a photo gallery of lightings on #Rotary Voices at http://blog.rotary.org/2014/01/16/india_gallery/

In United's 10 Million Charity Miles Giveaway  #Rotary got 3 368 099 airline miles -- or 36.64 percent of the total votes! These miles can be used for about 33 international airline tickets for humanitarian projects. Last year  Rotary got 2.5 million miles in the giveaway.  Thank you to all those who voted!

Inspired by the teachings of Confucius  Rotary International President-elect Gary C.K. Huang chose Light Up Rotary as his 2014-15 theme.  "Light Up Rotary is our theme  but it is more than our theme. It is how we live in #Rotary  how we think in Rotary  how we feel  how we work " Huang said.   Read more and find links to the theme logos at http://ow.ly/sxLZ9

India  until recently an epicenter of the wild poliovirus  is marking the third anniversary of its last recorded case of the paralyzing infectious disease of polio.  This milestone is a testament to the determination of #Rotary  and its partners -- and especially the 122 000 Rotary members in India -- to eradicate polio through the mass immunization of children. This is a goal Rotary took on in 1985.  In celebration of the decades-long battle and ultimate victory over this disabling disease in India  Rotary clubs throughout India will illuminate landmarks and iconic structures on 13 January.  Find out how you can help end #polio at www.endpolio.org.

Congratulations to Shriners Hospitals for Children on getting first place in United's Charity Miles Giveaway. We applaud the high-quality medical care you provide for children. The airline miles will go to a good cause.  Rotary members and friends of #Rotary  your time and voting efforts are appreciated. We should know by next week what the final vote totals are. Stay tuned!

Looking forward this year  some important milestones in our fight to end #polio are approaching.  In the The Wall Street Journal  India  #Rotary member  polio survivor and fighter RAMESH FERRIS talks about what it means to him that the World Health Organization may soon declare polio officially eradicated from its Southeast Asia zone  which includes 11 countries.
Happy New Year's to our #Rotary members and friends! Wishing you peace and joy in 2014!
With #Rotary at www.rotary.org/give  doing good is a resolution you can keep! How do you plan to do good in your community in 2014?

Take a minute and make a difference. Vote daily until 31 December at www.10millioncharitymiles.com/charity/26 from your computer  smartphone  and tablet for Rotary in United's 10 Million Charity Miles Giveaway.  #Rotary has used Charity Miles for Youth Exchange students whose families could not afford airline tickets  which had previously blocked their participation in the program  as well as to help with humanitarian water and sanitation projects.

Social media can help your #Rotary club attract donors and volunteers.   For example  share your news on social media on a regular basis so your friends and followers are reminded of the vital role you play in the community.  Read more on NTEN: The Nonprofit Technology Network at http://ow.ly/rTKFI.

A generous Santa's helper – and #Rotary member -- who wanted to put an end to #polio  a disease that can cripple children  wrote a book called "The Man in the Red Suit" and donated some of the proceeds to Rotary's PolioPlus funds.  With matching funds from the government of Canada and the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation the donation grew to $90 000  which can buy vaccine for 150 000 children.  Yes  there is a Santa Claus. A Happy Holidays to all!  Read more on the blog Rotary Voices at http://blog.rotary.org/2013/12/23/santa/#more-2730
Consider a gift to The Rotary Foundation. It helps sustain thousands of humanitarian projects worldwide. Learn more at  www.rotary.org/en/give.

RI President Ron Burton extended the early registration deadline to 15 January for the 2014 Rotary convention (#ricon14)  saving US$100 off the registration fee. Register now at www.riconvention.org/en/2014/Register/Pages/ridefault.aspx.  Read more at www.rotary.org/myrotary/en/discounted-early-registration-extended-2014-rotary-international-convention
For more than 25 years  #Rotary members have worked to rid the world of polio. The job is 99 percent complete. Find out how you can end #polio and help make history at www.endpolio.org.

Thank you for voting for #Rotary in United's 10 Million Charity Miles Giveaway at www.10millioncharitymiles.com/charity/26. Vote daily until 31 December and we will fly by last year's total of more than 2.5 million miles.  Together  we can make a difference in lives worldwide – from sending volunteers on National Immunization Days to giving students life-changing Rotary Youth Exchange experiences.  In Rotary's LinkedIn group at http://ow.ly/rTLUZ  give us feedback in a poll about how you would like the miles allocated.

We're proud of our long history of serving in communities. A look into our archives shows how #Rotary members have made changes to the motto  whose current wording is  "One Profits Most Who Serves Best." Read more at www.rotary.org/myrotary/en/history-rotarys-mottoes.  Also find out how you can join us at our June convention in Sydney at www.riconvention.org. #ricon14

Many thanks to Brazilian model and "This Close" #polio eradication ambassador Isabelli Fontana  designer Edu Pombal  and fashion label TUFI DUEK for donating the customized End Polio Now T-shirt (all pictured in the photo) to our recent fundraising campaign in Brazil.   Thank you to all our donors that generated nearly US$90 000 to support polio eradication efforts in the world.

Vote daily at www.10millioncharitymiles.com/charity/26 in United's 10 Million Charity Miles Giveaway and help us break our record of 2.5 million miles. The more votes and miles we get  the more lives we can change!

Rotary issues about 9 000 airline tickets each year to support our humanitarian programs. It takes about 2.5 million miles to get 25 coach airline tickets.  Every vote counts in United's 10 Million Charity Miles Giveaway. Vote daily at www.10millioncharitymiles.com/charity/26.
Skiing #Rotary Santas hit the slopes for a holiday toy drive -- and got their video on People.com!

Valentina went to Japan as a Rotary Youth Exchange student because last year people worldwide voted for Rotary in United’s 10 Million Charity Miles Giveaway.  Once again  you have the opportunity to vote for Rotary at http://10millioncharitymiles.com to help Rotarians get free airline miles to change lives.  Read more about Valentina in her #Rotary Voices blog post at http://blog.rotary.org/2013/11/13/valentina/.

What counts in life is not the mere fact that we have lived. It is what difference we have made to the lives of others that will determine the significance of the life we lead. — Nelson Mandela.   He will be missed. He made the difference in the lives of many  including those of the children in Africa who did not get the incurable and often crippling disease of #polio.  In 1996  some mainly Muslim African nations banned polio immunizations. Past RI President Herb Brown flew to South Africa to plead with that country's president  Nelson Mandela  for assistance.  Mandela called a press conference  with Brown at his side  and told the gathered reporters  "I am asking right now that the president of every country in Africa open their doors to allow Rotary  UNICEF  and WHO to make Africa polio-free. We in South Africa can already attest to the value of this program and South Africa is now polio-free. I ask that each president do the same for their children as we have done for ours."   Almost immediately  Africa once again put out the welcome mat for polio immunizations. In 1997  Nelson Mandela received the #Rotary Award for World Understanding.
It will be a long recovery process for Typhoon Haiyan victims  but #Rotary members are helping.  Read more at http://blog.rotary.org/2013/12/05/audenart/

It's International Volunteer Day (#IVD13). Worldwide  Rotary members volunteer their time  money  and skills to make a difference.    Rotary member Bud Tysinger  an ophthalmologist from the U.S.  has made more than 60 trips to Africa to help restore people's sight.  Rotarians from the Rotary clubs of Inverness Culloden  Scotland  and Bwaila  Malawi  provided proper toilet facilities for more than 10 000 children and water pumps for 1 100 people in Malawi.  Rotary members in Egypt have helped immunize children against #polio in response to the threat of the importation of polio from an outbreak in Syria.   In the photo  #Rotary member Fatma Barrada and her team organize their community National Immunization Days. Read a blog post about it at http://ow.ly/rsEkr.

Thank you for making a difference by giving to #Rotary and your community. We're calling and writing notes to some of our donors today  which is Giving Tuesday  to say thanks.  Join others in #GivingTuesday by helping others  which can be done through www.rotary.org/en/give. Join us in eradicating #polio  promoting peace  preventing disease  bolstering economic development  and providing clean water and sanitation. Every $1 donated to Rotary International for polio eradication will be tripled by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation.

Rotary member Kristi Govertsen is a RIOTT! Also known as Rotarians in Our Twenties and Thirties.  "People are starved for connection " Kristi says. "They want to get permission to be the nice  wonderful human beings they are inside." If everyone lets that out  Kristi says  people -- and #Rotary clubs -- have a chance for all kinds of unexpected connections.  Learn more about Rotary and how to connect with us at www.rotary.org.
Thank you to all those who follow us on social media and share #Rotary content! Have a wonderful Thanksgiving!

Rotary member Bill Decker is on the ground in the Philippines  as part of a ShelterBox Response Team to the island of Bantayan. He is amazed by the resilience he sees in the faces of the people following Typhoon Haiyan.   Decker blogs about Rotary's partnership with ShelterBox  which provides aid to thousands  in his post for our blog  #Rotary Voices  at http://blog.rotary.org/2013/11/27/philippines/

Thanks for giving to The #Rotary Foundation and in the community. As our thanks to you  comment on this post on 25 or 26 November about how you make a difference in the world and you could be selected to receive a copy of the book "40 Chances: Finding Hope in a Hungry World " by Howard G. Buffett.
Wonderful news about our progress in fighting #polio.
Two Rotary clubs used a global grant to fund a microcredit project in Honduras. In the new issue of Rotary Leader  learn their strategies for success. http://bit.ly/1bapxfO

On the International Day of #Tolerance  16 November  strengthen your commitment to promoting peace and harmony.  Ignorance  prejudice and hatred are at the root of discrimination and racism  says Irina Bokova  director-general of UNESCO. "We need education to disarm the fears that many feel of the unknown and of other people  their cultures  life choices and beliefs. Education is the best way to foster a culture of #peace and build inclusive societies."  Learn more about the #Rotary Peace Centers and how to support them at www.rotary.org/rotarycenters.

Our sympathy to those affected by Typhoon Haiyan and stands ready to come to the aid of the more than 21 000 Philippine Rotarians and the communities they serve.  We have reached out to #Rotary district governors in the affected areas to determine what type of support will be most effective. Updates will be made available as information is received.  Rotary partner ShelterBox has committed aid for 4 000 families in the Philippines in the form of emergency shelter and other relief assistance.   You can send questions and information about Typhoon Haiyan relief efforts to relief@rotary.org.

Polio  a crippling virus without a cure  has been lurking in the Middle East region. The ongoing conflict in Syria had halted vaccination campaigns  and #polio struck.  The polio "virus is vicious. It is going to travel  and it will seek out the vulnerable. The only way to prevent outbreaks like the one we are seeing in Syria is to stop it here in Pakistan. And the sooner the better " says Aziz Memon  Rotary International's PolioPlus chairman for Pakistan.  Read more in TIME. At www.endpolio.org  learn how #Rotary has been fighting to end polio.
Our thoughts are with all those impacted by Typhoon Haiyan.  Learn how you can help through ShelterBox at http://www.shelterbox.org/news_global.php?id=1200  #Rotary

In The New York Times  read about the work Rotary First Harvest is doing to feed hungry families. Rotary First Harvest - a program of Rotary District 5030  a charity based in Seattle  Washington  USA  collects surplus produce from local growers to distribute to area food banks.   The article not only recognizes Rotary First Harvest  but it also draws attention to Rotary's humanitarian mission and the good work Rotary clubs carry out worldwide.  Watch a video about #Rotary First Harvest at http://vimeo.com/59920096

Telling your community about your Rotary club helps keep your club growing and vital. Ask the Rotary Club of Champaign.  By telling the community about its 97-year history  which is part of their strategic plan of "Awareness and Growth " the #Rotary club introduced 17 new members since 1 July.  Every Rotary member in their club is asked to bring new members to the club. They now have 174 active members and 10 honorary members  for a total of 184 members.  Furthermore  the Rotary Club of Champaign has taken action and changed lives in their community by distributing more than US$15 000 dollars in local project grants. Their club foundation will donate more than $70 000 next month to local nonprofit organizations.  The club also introduced and sponsored a new provisional club (Piatt County Rotary Club) with 15 members and growing to be chartered!  Great job  Rotary Club of Champaign!  In the photo are club members Janna Sartini and John Calderon.

Nearly 200 people recorded their fond memories of Interact  our program for students age 12 -18  at a special booth during the 2013 #Rotary convention in Lisbon.   It's Interact Week! Read on our blog Rotary Voices at http://blog.rotary.org/2013/07/29/interactbooth/ about how Interact touches lives and ignites a passion for service.  Enter in our video contest and show us how your Interact club is creating positive change. And you might win US$500! Learn more at https://www.rotary.org/myrotary/en/enter-interact-video-contest-chance-win-500

Create a more peaceful world? Provide clean water? Fight #polio? Help women and children receive healthcare? Yes  Rotary members do this and more through The #Rotary Foundation!  Tackle some of the world's most pressing needs when you give to the Foundation at http://www.rotary.org/give. November is Rotary Foundation Month.

#Rotary founder Paul Harris planted trees as a symbol of good will. In 1936  he planted trees in Chile  Peru  Colombia  Argentina  and Brazil.   Read a quote from Harris  and more about the history behind his tree planting  on our blog  Rotary Voices.

A chance encounter on the side of a dusty road deep in the Queensland Outback will forever change the life of one teenager  thanks to the magic of #Rotary Youth Exchange.   Read more on our blog  Rotary Voices.

Rotary-United Nations Day is 2 November. Rotary members and friends of #Rotary will gather at the UN Headquarters in New York City.  In 1942  Rotary clubs from 21 nations organized a conference in London to develop a vision for advancing education  science  and culture after World War II. That event was a precursor to UNESCO. In 1945  49 Rotarians helped draft the UN Charter. Rotary and the UN have been close partners ever since  a relationship that's apparent through our work together on polio eradication.  Learn more at www.riunday.org.

Literacy and poverty are closely connected  and at least 1.2 billion poor people can’t read or write. Through The Rotary Foundation  we are taking action in communities and globally to make a difference.  November is #Rotary Foundation Month. Our Foundation has strong financial oversight  a stellar charity rating  and a unique funding model mean that we make the very most of your contribution.  Give at www.rotary.org/give and change lives.

At a hospital in Guinea  staff members touch patients without gloves  going patient to patient without washing hands. There are unbandaged wounds  flies and roaches  open sewage right outside a patient facility and no sterile barriers.  With Mercy Ships  Rotarians are helping tackle a wide-range of medical tasks there and other local hospitals.

They went to deliver shoes to school children  but soon discovered the needs were far greater. With the help of Rotary’s powerful network  Rotary members in Soldotna  Alaska  were able to give the children of Masaya  Nicaragua  a better school in a healthier environment.   Read more in Leonor Fraser's story for our blog  #Rotary Voices.

Polio was recently confirmed in Syria  a country that has been free of this disabling and potentially fatal disease since 1999. In response  health authorities in Syria and neighbouring countries have launched urgent  large-scale  multi-country immunization campaigns to ensure that every child is reached with the #polio vaccine.   #Rotary and its partners in the Global Polio Eradication Initiative are working together with local health authorities to activate the outbreak response.  We  as Rotarians  remain steadfast in our commitment to a polio-free world  and we will continue our efforts until polio is gone forever.   Read more from Dr. Bob Scott  chair of Rotary's International PolioPlus Committee  at http://ow.ly/qkxKU  Photo by Rotary International/Alyce Henson from our Instagram feed @rotaryinternational

Worldwide  #Rotary members and friends of Rotary take action in their communities through service projects. We've got a free webinar on 19 November in English (In December  the webinar will be offered in Japanese  Spanish  French  and Portuguese.) that can help you understand the importance of building measurement  evaluation  and sustainability into your service project -- and more.  This is part two  "Planning and Organizing " of the five-part Lifecycle of a Service Project series. Space is limited so register now on www.rotary.org/webinars.

Today marks the anniversary of the birth of Jonas Salk  who developed a vaccine against #polio. The vaccine  released for general use in 1955  gave the world the upper hand against the disease.   But getting the vaccine everywhere it needs to be so no child is ever crippled by this disease has been a challenge. Polio survivor Kurt Sipolski remembers Salk and explains why we must continue the job of eradication to its finish  in his post for our blog  #Rotary Voices.

Hunger permeates our society in way most people don't understand  said Howard G. Buffett. Worldwide Rotarians help fight #hunger and provide opportunities for others that can end the cycle of poverty. Learn more about Rotary at www.rotary.org.  Learn about what  Howard G. Buffett  farmer  businessman  politician  and philanthropist  learned about fighting hunger at www.40chances.com.

Happy World #Polio Day! We're celebrating today with a live global update at 5:30 p.m. Central (Chicago). The event is open to the public and available through Livestream at http://ow.ly/pH1ED.  At the event  we'll hear from polio ambassador and actress Archie Panjabi; Dr. Bruce Aylward  World Health Organization (WHO) assistant director-general for polio  emergencies and country collaboration; Dr. Robert Murphy  director of the Center for Global Health at Northwestern University Feinberg School of Medicine; and polio survivor and world-class Paralympian Dennis Ogbe  an ambassador for the United Nations Foundation's Shot@Life campaign to promote childhood immunizations.  See Archie Panjabie's video about why she’s involved in ending polio with #Rotary. Why are you involved in eradicating polio?

World Polio Day is 24 October. Dennis Ogbe  a U.S. Paralympic athlete who regained use of his right leg after a childhood bout with the disease  explains why we can't afford to lose the fight against polio.   Read his blog post  and see how you can help celebrate World Polio Day  on our blog  #Rotary Voices.

Working to prevent online bullying is another way to apply one of Rotary's areas of focus  peace and conflict prevention/resolution.  More needs to be done to raise awareness about online bullying and how to take action to stop it  says Don Higgins  of the #Rotary Club of Pinellas Park  Tampa Bay  Florida  USA.  Learn more by visiting the Rotarian Action Group for Peace.

Rotary member Ann Lee Hussey has been on 21 polio immunization trips. A polio survivor  Hussey knows how important it is to see our polio eradication efforts through to their conclusion. Read more of her story  and learn what you can do to help on our blog  #Rotary Voices  at http://blog.rotary.org/2013/10/21/hussey/  Join us on 24 October  World Polio Day  for a live global event on the status of #polio eradication. Northwestern University's Dr. Robert Murphy  from the Center for Global Health  will be part of the program along with actress and polio ambassador Archie Panjabi; Dr. Bruce Aylward of the World Health Organization (WHO)  and Paralympian and polio survivor Dennis Ogbe.   Learn more at http://ow.ly/pH1ED

Join #Rotary and polio ambassador and Emmy-winning actress Archie Panjabi for a live global update on the fight to end polio on World Polio Day  24 October. Add the event to your calendar at http://ow.ly/pH1ED  Archie spoke at the 2013 RI Convention about how as a child she saw #polio victims in the streets of India.

You're putting the updated #Rotary look to work! If you've visited the Rotary website lately  you've seen examples of the bold new visual identity in action. The graphic below also is an example that you can share on your social networks.  Many Rotarians are eager to implement the new visual guidelines in their clubs and districts and naturally some have questions about how to get started. Read more at https://www.rotary.org/myrotary/en/putting-our-new-look-work and see examples of how Rotarians are using the new look to strengthen Rotary's image in their communities.

Ade Adepitan contracted #polio in Lagos  Nigeria  when he was just over a year old. He had been given two drops of the oral vaccine but the virus caught him before he received a third and final drop.   A broadcaster and former Paralympian in England  Adepitan returned to Lagos earlier this year to make a documentary on polio and discover what his life might have been like had he not been raised in London and had he not driven himself to succeed despite his disability.   Read more of his story on our blog  #Rotary Voices.

In this photo  Interactors are registering children for immunization as part of a National Immunization Day in Nigeria in 1996. At about that time  there were about 70 polio-endemic countries. Today  Nigeria is only one of three polio-endemic countries left. Learn more at www.endpolio.org.  Join us on World #Polio Day  24 October  and learn how you can End Polio Now.   #tbt #rotaryhistory #endpolio

Join us on October 24 for a live global World Polio Day event on the status of polio eradication. Northwestern University's Dr. Robert Murphy  from the Center for Global Health  will be part of the program along with Dr. Bruce Aylward of the World Health Organization (WHO)  and Paralympian and polio survivor Dennis Ogbe.   Learn more at http://ow.ly/pH1ED

Take a look at how #Rotary and friends providing food to people in the Seattle area  or read more at http://ow.ly/pQd35.  About 870 million people worldwide are chronically undernourished. Raise awareness on 16 October  World Food Day (#wfd2013). Share on social media what you and Rotary are doing to help stop hunger.
How will you recognize World Polio Day  24 October?

Grant Wilkins contracted #polio in 1951. The past RI director would eventually recover  but his first wife wasn’t so lucky. She spent two and a half years in an iron lung  and the rest of her life with a respirator.   Read more of why eradicating polio is important to Wilkins in his blog post for #Rotary Voices.  On World Polio Day  24 October  learn how we're making history. Join Rotary's Livestream Event for a polio eradication update at http://ow.ly/oh9kd

Polio mainly affects children under age 5 and can cause lifelong paralysis. The efforts of #Rotary members to eradicate polio have prevented more than 5 million children worldwide from getting #polio.  On World Polio Day  24 October  join Rotary's Livestream Event for an update on how we're making history: http://ow.ly/oh9kd

Tanya Wolff is not a runner. But the Canadian Rotary club member and past district governor will run for polio. Three times  in fact  she has completed marathons to raise awareness for polio eradication.   Read more of her story  in honor of World #Polio Day  on #Rotary Voices.  http://blog.rotary.org/2013/10/10/wolff/

Some countries lose more than US$1 billion per year by failing to educate girls to the same level as boys. Furthermore  women's education has prevented more than 4 million child deaths in the past 40 years.   It's International Day of the Girl Child - October 11 (#dayofthegirl). Two of our areas of focus are basic education and literacy and maternal and child health. Tell us about your club's projects in these areas. You also can support #Rotary clubs at www.rotary.org/en/give.

Sydney is hosting #Rotary International's 105th annual convention 1-4 June 2014  which is expected to attract more than 18 000 Rotary club members from more than 150 countries while injecting an estimated AUD 60.5 million into the local economy.  NSW Premier Barry O'Farrell said Rotary clubs and volunteers around the world provide outstanding service to the community and Sydney is proud to host the 2014 Rotary International Convention.  "Sydney is the major events capital of the Asia Pacific and this event provides us with another fantastic opportunity to showcase our harbor city to the thousands of Rotary delegates travelling here from around the world."  Register and learn more at www.riconvention.org (#ricon14)  In the photo: Premier Barry O'Farrell  RI President Ron Burton and his wife  Jetta.

If India can stop polio  so can Pakistan. Hear more in this PBS video about #polio eradication efforts in Pakistan  one of three countries where the crippling disease is endemic. Two years ago  India also was on the list of polio-endemic countries. Polio is still endemic in Afghanistan and Nigeria.  Read more about #Rotary and the fight to end polio at www.endpolio.org. Also  join us for a live global update on 24 October  World Polio Day.

Service is what #Rotary does  but polio is what has truly helped define us. Jennifer Jones  moderator for Rotary's Livestream event for World #Polio Day  24 October  shares how the campaign to eradicate polio has drawn community and business leaders together and increased our understanding of the need for partnerships.   Read more in her blog post for Rotary Voices.

Each year  #Rotary selects individuals from around the world to receive fully funded academic fellowships at one of our peace centers. Read more about the Rotary #Peace Centers at www.rotary.org/en/peace-fellowships.
A polio survivor paralyzed from the neck down talks about life in a hospital in Brazil.   Find out how you can learn more about #polio at http://ow.ly/oh9kd.    Read more in #Rotary Voices.

Share on social media the work of #Rotary in your community and globally. You spread the message about our work in polio eradication for World #Polio Day  24 October.  Learn more at http://new.livestream.com/rotaryinternational/worldpolioday.
Learn from the pros some tips on how to select top candidates for Rotary scholarships  now in #Rotary Leader.

In Chennai  India  from 5 to 6 October  Rotary International President Ron Burton  friends of Rotary  and Rotarians will reach out to more than 20 000 people to talk about how youth can help lead and make the future better.  You can find out more about upcoming conferences at www.facebook.com/RotaryPresident/events or learn more about the first #Rotary International Presidential Conference on New Generations.

It's Vocational Service Month! What's your club doing?   See how #Rotary members in Virginia  USA  use their vocational skills to mentor high school students and prepare them for life beyond graduation.   Read Scott Lyon’s blog post in Rotary Voices.
